Package com.example.eventlotterysystemapplication.Model

Class Event

java.lang.Object
com.example.eventlotterysystemapplication.Model.Event
public class Event extends Object
An instance of this object represents a single instance of an event

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Event()
    An empty constructor for the Event class, is used because it makes it easier to parse a document from Firebase and set specific fields to the values extracted from Firebase
    Event(String name, String description, String place, String[] eventTags, String organizerID, String eventStartTime, String eventEndTime, String registrationStartTime, String registrationEndTime, String invitationAcceptanceDeadline, int maxWaitingListCapacity, int maxFinalListCapacity, Boolean geolocationRequirement)
    This constructor can also allow for the instantiation of the event object from the program, but the main purpose here is to help with testing
    Event(String name, String description, String place, ArrayList<String> eventTags, String organizerID, LocalDateTime eventStartTime, LocalDateTime eventEndTime, LocalDateTime registrationStartTime, LocalDateTime registrationEndTime, LocalDateTime invitationAcceptanceDeadline, int maxWaitingListCapacity, int maxFinalListCapacity, Boolean geolocationRequirement)
    A constructor whose main purpose is to allow for the instantiation of the event object from the program itself

    Description
    void
    addEntrantToCancelledList(Entrant entrant)
    Given that the user is currently in the chosen list, they can then be added to the cancelled list, as per how the lifecycle of the event should go
    void
    addEntrantToChosenList(Entrant entrant)
    Given that the user is currently in the waiting list, they can then be added to the chosen list, as per how the lifecycle of the event should go
    void
    addEntrantToFinalizedList(Entrant entrant)
    Adds the entrant to the finalized list, given that they are in the chosen list already, as per how the lifecycle of the event should go

  • Constructor Details

    • Event

      public Event()
      An empty constructor for the Event class, is used because it makes it easier to parse a document from Firebase and set specific fields to the values extracted from Firebase

    • Event

      public Event(String name, String description, String place, ArrayList<String> eventTags, String organizerID, LocalDateTime eventStartTime, LocalDateTime eventEndTime, LocalDateTime registrationStartTime, LocalDateTime registrationEndTime, LocalDateTime invitationAcceptanceDeadline, int maxWaitingListCapacity, int maxFinalListCapacity, Boolean geolocationRequirement)
      A constructor whose main purpose is to allow for the instantiation of the event object from the program itself
      Parameters:
      name - The event's name
      description - The event's description
      place - The event's location
      eventTags - The event's tags
      organizerID - The ID of the user who organizes the event
      eventStartTime - The start time of the event
      eventEndTime - The ending time of the event
      registrationStartTime - The time when the registration for the event opens
      registrationEndTime - The time when the registration for the event closes
      invitationAcceptanceDeadline - The deadline for accepting the invitation for the event, assuming that you were selected by the lottery
      maxWaitingListCapacity - The maximum capacity of the waiting list
      maxFinalListCapacity - The maximum number of people who can be chosen for the event by the lottery system
      geolocationRequirement - Boolean representing if geolocation requirement is enabled

    • Event

      public Event(String name, String description, String place, String[] eventTags, String organizerID, String eventStartTime, String eventEndTime, String registrationStartTime, String registrationEndTime, String invitationAcceptanceDeadline, int maxWaitingListCapacity, int maxFinalListCapacity, Boolean geolocationRequirement)
      This constructor can also allow for the instantiation of the event object from the program, but the main purpose here is to help with testing
      Parameters:
      name - The event's name
      description - The event's description
      place - The event's location
      eventTags - The event's tags
      organizerID - The ID of the user who organizes the event
      eventStartTime - The start time of the event
      eventEndTime - The ending time of the event
      registrationStartTime - The time when the registration for the event opens
      registrationEndTime - The time when the registration for the event closes
      invitationAcceptanceDeadline - The deadline for accepting the invitation for the event, assuming that you were selected by the lottery
      maxWaitingListCapacity - The maximum capacity of the waiting list, or -1 if there's no limit
      maxFinalListCapacity - The maximum number of people who can be chosen for the event by the lottery system
      geolocationRequirement - Boolean representing if geolocation requirement is enabled

    • getRecurringFrequency

      public int getRecurringFrequency()
      Gets recurring frequency of an event
      Returns:
      recurring frequency: 1 means daily, 2 means weekly, 3 means monthly, 4 means yearly, -1 means no recurrence

      The list of entrants

    • addToEntrantList

      public void addToEntrantList(User user, EntrantLocation entrantLocation)
      Adds user to the entrantList, given their geolocation value
      Parameters:
      user - The user that wants to join as an entrant
      entrantLocation - The location that the entrant joined the waiting list from

    • addToEntrantList

      public void addToEntrantList(Entrant entrant) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Adds a user to the entrant list as a waiting user, given that they don't exist in the current list already
      Parameters:
      entrant - The user to be added to the waiting list
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException

    • addEntrantToChosenList

      public void addEntrantToChosenList(Entrant entrant)
      Given that the user is currently in the waiting list, they can then be added to the chosen list, as per how the lifecycle of the event should go
      Parameters:
      entrant - The entrant that wants to join the chosen list

    • addEntrantToCancelledList

      public void addEntrantToCancelledList(Entrant entrant)
      Given that the user is currently in the chosen list, they can then be added to the cancelled list, as per how the lifecycle of the event should go
      Parameters:
      entrant - The entrant that wants to join the cancelled list

    • addEntrantToFinalizedList

      public void addEntrantToFinalizedList(Entrant entrant)
      Adds the entrant to the finalized list, given that they are in the chosen list already, as per how the lifecycle of the event should go
      Parameters:
      entrant - The entrant that wants to join the finalized list

    • isEntrantExists

      public boolean isEntrantExists(Entrant entrant)
      Checks if the entrant exists in the current entrant list already
      Parameters:
      entrant - The entrant that we want to check for membership in the entrantList
      Returns:
      True if the entrant exists, false otherwise

    • genEntrantIfExists

      public Entrant genEntrantIfExists(User user)
      Returns the entrant object from the entrantList, given that the user that is being used to query exists in the list as an entrant object
      Parameters:
      user - The user that we want to query the entrantList for
      Returns:
      The entrant object containing the user if the user exists, otherwise null

    • removeEntrant

      public boolean removeEntrant(Entrant entrant)
      Removes the entrant from the entrantList
      Parameters:
      entrant - The entrant that we would like to remove
      Returns:
      True if we could remove them, false otherwise

      Returns:
      A bitmap object of the QR code image

    • generateQRCode

      public void generateQRCode()
      Using the eventID, and the hardcoded scheme and activity/host, we can create a QR code that, when scanned by a phone with this app installed, will open up the app with the event description page
